reviews.review_msg: No way you fail his class if you do all his practices. Final was pretty hard though. However, as long as you do his practices every week, you'll pass.

I repeated this course with Yonas only, first time I did not study at all but second time around I never skipped a class did all Lab work questions did all assignments and quizzes on my own rather than use chat gpt.
overall Awesome professor and clear grading criteria
He's a very good professorâ€”you should definitely take his class, even though the final is a bit tough and the lab assignments are quite demanding.
Honestly the ones that are saying he tough grader or his lectures are boring haven't seen SFU 2nd lecturers and how bad they are.
His exams are very difficult and you need to study more than what you learn in class to pass them. The impact of quizzes and homework on the overall grade is minimal.

Great lectures. I just attended the classes and did the assignments myself without any external help and was able to do well in his course. He is always willing to help students during the lab session so take full advantage of the lab session to clear your doubts.

Hate this Prof, very lecture heavy and they are boring, even the minutest mistakes are punished and Most Importantly has a wrong approach in teaching Computer Science, liking using the most outdated software, hand written exams etc. (coming from a 3.45+ GPA holder)
He is patient and willing to help students. If you do not work hard, your grade will be hard. He is a nice teacher but the material needs lots of practice.

Teaches everything clearly. Everything you need is in his slides which he posts so it's easy to review. Seems intimidating at first but he's really more like a dad who gives tough love. He'll help you with any problem you have. Tough exams, but as long as you practice you'll do great.
He is a very good teacher who tries his best  that the students can understand the concept . Course is super easy if you do all the lab work as exams are related to it . Also he is ean easy grader .

Although his exams are pretty tough, he teaches the best. The flow and the way he teaches will make you the best programmer. Also, his lab works are super tough which makes it easier. 

So, in short, this course is for people who are keen and desperate on learning programming.

Yonas really helped me understand the course material, I also found him very understanding. Make sure to do the lab exercises as it is good practice for the exams. The final and midterm exam was hard though, so make sure to study hard for those. Plus, he's a cutie.
Cool course that makes u learn abt c++. Some parts are fairly interesting and overall i'd say these 2 courses are fairly easy. Yonas uploads useful materials that helps u get a good grade.

Other teachers at FIC told me he purposely fails students to earn money. He will fail you no matter how hard you try so you retake the course and he can make money. He is greedy for money. His marking is unfair. I am at SFU now, no upper-year course has a harsh marking, and no one deducts 25% or 50 % for a small error as he does.

Yonas probably has one of the worst course outlines in FIC. For example, you can do well during the entire course and a single midterm or final exam can destroy you. For sure it will, because the tasks he provides during the exams are extremely difficult. Should mention that Yonas is a tough grader, and he can deduct up to 75% from the correct answ

Do not take this course, i'd even say avoid this school at all costs. Not only is Dr yonas the worst teacher i have ever met he failed me just because my finals failed and did not show an ounce of sympathy. Literally had 60% before the final 25% to add on. I dont know exactly what happened but apparently my finals failed and I got an F.

The course is very disorganized. I've spent ~90 hours (I've been tracking) working on this course and yet only got a C+. The next semester I took the same class with professor Jiang Ye and got an A. He does not inspire you to work harder and mocks you when you have questions. Also he gives looooots of work and expects you to complete all of them.

His quizzes are ten times harder than his lectures and practice material and you will be struggling each week just to barely pass the course. No clear grading criteria either so you may get 75% and still fail.

He is the worst professor I encountered at FIC. Incredibly disorganized and expects us to spend all our time studying this course. I got better marks in higher-level courses at SFU without having to spend as much time and frustration on them. Additionally, he is very discouraging and purposefully fails his students by adding weight to wrong answers

He definitely fakes the 4/5 rating. More than 60% of students fail the course on the first try and have to re-attempt it to transfer. He is incredibly discouraging and mocks students when they ask for help. His quizzes and exams are graded to ensure your failure, so you need to repeat this course and spend $s. Each week is cruel and soul-wrecking.

He is a very good professor he always teach the material very clearly and if you don't have any basics he is a good professor. However, you should be very aware that there's a lot of labwork to do in order to understand the material provided, and you can't expect to slack in the course since it's programming after all! I will take his class again.

terrible he treated everyone like those kids from india who have already learned coding before. his questions are long and tough, too hard for anyone who first learn coding. 4hour lecture just sucks. i can do all the quizzes from another instructor doing this course but i can't even pass his course

He really inspires students to learn more about coding and problem solving. Although he does send many optional lab questions, they are very useful for practicing for the quizzes. He is a great professor!!! and has office hours every Saturday to clear any doubt.

He is the worst ever, he thought everyone in his class is in CS he doesn't care engineering students, he has 50 questions per week asking you to type the code. If I'm in CS yes cmpt is the only thing I need to take care of. But no, besides this course engineering also need to do calculus physics etc. I would rather learn this in college

One of the best professors in FIC. Dr. Weldeselassie is really caring when you have problems with lab works or quiz and he makes sure that your problem is solved during the office hours. The lecture notes and videos were awesome.

WORST PROFF EVER, he doesn't understand that his course isn't the only thing that matters. His lectures videos are sometimes over 5 hours long per week. Nobody has time for that + a weekly quiz + random assignments that he gives us a week to do but involve hours of work that an engineering student doesn't have! His expectations are too unrealistic.
His lecture was very clear, but his quiz was a disaster. In particular, the quiz score can only be passed or not, either you get a full score, or you can only get 10% or 20%.
Yonas is a good instructor but he is a very tough grader.

His lectures are sub par, he'll do the bare minimum but nothing more. His grading is unreasonably hard and he's mostly non cooperative. His email replies are quick. Try to avoid taking his class. I loved computing BEFORE I took his class...
hes the reason why I am still doing computing science
Best Professor for computing science. Very inspirational. Marks well for the amount of work you show. Office hours and labworks are a must to ace this course.

Best professor for someone who is new to coding. Clears all the basics before starting the course. Explains all the topics rally well. His grading can never go wrong. Do Lab-works regularly to ace this course. Attend his office hours for regular updates and to clear your doubts. Video lectures are very informative and are sufficient for the topic.

He is absolutely great Prof and has outstanding teaching skills. His video lectures and notes covers every topic with a great information that each and every doubt of yours will be explained in there. He is passionate about the quality of education to be delivered to students. The more you interact with him, the more you learn from him. Awesome!!
He is the best teacher, I've met for computer programming.

Great prof!! Super friendly and approachable, he may make fun of you just a little bit (attending office hour last minute :p) and your silly problems but it's all in good faith! His slides are very informative but make sure to watch his videos since it covers a lot more than what he has in the slides. Highly recommended prof!

Great and easy to understand slide. The class I had was online, yet I had no problem following and learning the course material solely with slides(didn't watch his recorded lecture as recording was poor). However, we got 0 grades for the weekly quizzes until week 11(out of total 13 weeks). He is literally the opposite end of "timely feedback."
Super strict

He's an amazing teacher with great concept clarity. He clears every doubt and actually can sense the doubt that arises in your mind through a mere eye contact during lecture. He gives lot's of homework and solves some of it in class. However, he seems to not like people who answer a lot or give alternate solutions. Sometimes gets rude holds grudges
really dedicated teacher

Best teacher if you are starting to learn coding and he will guide you through everything in detail. He gives a lot of lab question so if you do them all definetly you are going to score good in final and any other exams of his. Yes he is a bit strict prof but he will provide a strong base in academics to be successful afterwards in your major.

Amazing professor, will guide you through the logic required for this course. His lectures and slides perfectly grasp the concept of the course. Gives a lot of fun excercises and tests, which can be quite difficult if you are not on top your game. Definitely would recommend.
The most amazing teacher. I took both 130 and 135 with him. He is a tough grader but you understand the logic quite well if u carefully pay attention in his class.

He is a really good instructor. Read all his lecture notes carefully and do all his lab works, you are guaranteed at least an A-. He does answer every question carefully. Please try answer to answer and check for every possible mistake before asking him.

Yonas is truly an amazing prof. He's one of those profs that really make you love the course and actually make you excited to attend his lectures. If you're taking CMPT 130 he can be a tough grader. He gives lots and lots of lab work questions to practice as homework. But if you do all of them and attend his lectures you'll have no problems at all.
pros + explains in details + asks for feedback (in the class) cons - doesn't have active office-hours - rude sometimes

He gets strong accent and sometimes it seems that he is speaking his homeland language rather than English. Moreover, he is really irresponsible. He always forget to pose lecture materials on the Moodle page and sometimes he refuse to answer your questions! What's worse, he always smoking during the break time and forgot come to classroom.
THIS IS THE PROF THAT MADE ME INTERESTED IN CODING AGAIN AND MADE ME WORK ON MY OWN RATHER THAN SPOON FEEDING. He is the best. You'll say the same after the end of your semester with him.
Great teacher

He gets strong accent and sometimes it seems that he is speaking his homeland language rather than English. He can make us understand some of the classes but mostly his lecture is really confusing. Moreover, he is really irresponsible. He always forget to pose lecture materials on the Moodle page and sometimes he refuse to answer your questions!

HE IS THE BEST. I took CMPT130/135 with him last year and because of him I have very strong foundations in C++. There is no prof who can teach C++ better than him. You just need to understand his slides and you can do all assignments, midterms and final without touching the book. His programming assignments really help in understanding too.
would't take his class again
irresponsible
Hardest thing I have even done.
He will clear all your doubts. Amazing prof
Friendly
Amazing Lecture
Helpful. willing to share and help.
Amazing Lecture, Caring, Participation Matters.
Amazing
Awesome teacher who makes coding easy. No need for the textbook. Gives lots of good (optional) practice. Will definitely take him again.
Participation Matters. Skip Class? You won't pass. Amazing Lecture.
